p: When asked about where they got information about dengue fever many of the respondents (60%) said at the hospital ( Table 4). The majority of dengue patients only became aware of dengue fever when they were already infected. Despite a widespread radio, newspaper and television coverage of the epidemic, radio and television were only mentioned as a source of information about dengue by 38% and 25% of respondents, respectively, although there was higher radio ownership among dengue patientsâ€™ households 79%. None of the respondents mentioned attending a local government meeting about dengue infection during the outbreak while seeing banners and public announcements were mentioned by 1% of respondents recalling dengue fever information.
